articles.author: Alexander Cornwell, James Oliphant
articles.description: Iran and Israel exchanged fresh attacks early on Saturday, a day after Tehran said it would not negotiate over its nuclear programme while under threat and Europe tried to keep peace talks alive.
articles.title: Iran, Israel launch new attacks after Tehran rules out nuclear talks

articles.author: Francois Murphy, John Irish, Parisa Hafezi, Olivia Le Poidevin
articles.description: European foreign ministers urged Iran on Friday to engage with the United States over its nuclear programme after high-level talks in Geneva aimed at opening negotiations for a new nuclear deal ended with little sign of progress.
articles.title: Europe foreign ministers see 'perilous' moment, urge Iran to talk to US

articles.author: Jonathan Allen, Luc Cohen
articles.description: Mahmoud Khalil, a legal permanent resident of the United States, says he is being punished for his political speech in violation of the U.S. Constitution's First Amendment.
articles.title: US judge orders release of pro-Palestinian activist Khalil

articles.author: Tim Reid
articles.description: Republican Vice President JD Vance on Friday met troops who have been deployed in Los Angeles to quell protests against immigration raids, as he accused Democratic state and city leaders of encouraging immigrants to cross the U.S. border illegally.
articles.title: Vance, in Los Angeles, says troops need to stay, blasts Newsom over immigration

articles.author: Dietrich Knauth
articles.description: A U.S. appeals court let Donald Trump on Thursday retain control over California's National Guard while the state's Democratic governor proceeds with a lawsuit challenging the legality of the Republican president's use of the troops to quell protests and unrest in Los Angeles.
articles.title: US court lets Trump retain control of California National Guard for now

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Olivia Le Poidevin
articles.description: Children will begin to die of thirst, a spokesperson said.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 44 Palestinians in Gaza, UN warns of drought

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: Hundreds of American citizens have departed Iran using land routes over the past week since an aerial war between the Islamic Republic and Israel broke out, according to an internal State Department cable seen by Reuters on Friday.
articles.title: Hundreds of US citizens left Iran in last week, State Dept cable says

articles.author: David Brunnstrom, Doina Chiacu
articles.description: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres warned on Friday that expansion of the Israel-Iran conflict could "ignite a fire no one can control" and called on both sides and potential parties to the conflict to "give peace a chance."
articles.title: UN's Guterres urges 'give peace a chance' in Israel-Iran conflict

articles.author: Tarek Amara
articles.description: A Tunisian court on Friday handed down a 22‑year prison sentence in absentia to former President Moncef Marzouki, a fierce critic of President Kais Saied, on charges of undermining state security, raising the opposition's fears of an escalating crackdown against critics.
articles.title: Tunisia sentences ex-President Marzouki to 22 years in absentia

articles.author: Brad Brooks
articles.description: Police in Ohio said on Friday they had arrested a man after he allegedly ran a U.S. Congressman off a road, threatened the politician and his family, and yelled antisemitic slurs and waved a Palestinian flag before fleeing.
articles.title: Ohio man charged for allegedly threatening US Congressman Max Miller
